website_summaries.verdict: The Hitachi is a fine choice, but based on ease of use and durability, better options exist.
pros: Is well-built and provides plenty of power
cons: Plastic parts do not hold up
Design leads to extra weight on the left

customer_reviews.title: Up to the task of a deck restoration project.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this tool to strip several layers of paint off an old, 400 sq. ft. deck. The sander performed admirably even when pushed hard for several hours of continuous work. I did not find the tool to be overly heavy or unbalanced.
customer_reviews.author: mac

customer_reviews.title: Quality tool at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: First off, this product is of very high quality. there is no plastic, and it is heavy. putting on the belt is very easy, just pull back the lever , put in the belt, and lock the lever. I really like the adjustment knob, so easy to use. Set it and forget it. As far as sanding, it does an excellent job, you just let the sander do the job and guide it. don't need to put pressure on it as it is heavy enough to sand. One of the best tools I own.
customer_reviews.author: Richard C. Courtney

customer_reviews.title: Wished I had found it sooner. Used it for ...
customer_reviews.text: Wished I had found it sooner. Used it for the first time today for about four hours. Heavy duty construction. Belts track very well with minor occasional adjustments. The sander dust bag works very well. The sander exceeded my expectation. Just a note, we have purchased two other belt sanders (made by other manufacturers) in the last six years. It did not take long before we were unhappy with both of them (belts didn't track well or tended to catch and shred; sanders didn't collect dust well, etc. It is already obvious the Hitachi surpasses their performances.
customer_reviews.author: GMcConnell

customer_reviews.title: Bought new and received a very used sander
customer_reviews.text: Purchased a new belt sander and received a significantly used belt sander
customer_reviews.author: Keith Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Good quality sander
customer_reviews.text: I had water damage in my basement recently and needed to sand down the sub-flooring where it had swelled, so I could lay a new vinyl plank flooring. Never owned a belt sander before, so researched online and the fact that I have had Hitachi power tools before and been pleased with them I decided to get this one. The sander works like a dream. Did a great job with my floor and I am very pleased with the purchase. Highly recommend this item!
customer_reviews.author: Whistler

customer_reviews.title: Nope
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how this got such great reviews. I had used a Porter Cable before that was great - more expensive but worth it. The belt doesn't track right if it is used in a back and forth motion. I can only use it side to side which is strange. And projects seem to take twice as long compared to the Porter and Cable.
customer_reviews.author: jkoch

customer_reviews.title: I am very glad that I did not
customer_reviews.text: Obviously I could of purchased a much cheaper belt sander. I am very glad that I did not. For the extra money that I spent this is a very well built heavy sander built to specifications that take advantage of modern developments while keeping high quality as a priority. With 9 amps there is plenty of power.
customer_reviews.author: Delmar Crim

customer_reviews.title: Solid sander
customer_reviews.text: Works well for what I need, making hobby electric guitars and shaping hard wood with 40 grit, only thing that could use improvement, as with most sanders, the dust bag will inevitably start to fray and get caught in the zipper
customer_reviews.author: Mth44

customer_reviews.title: EXcellent
customer_reviews.text: I've used to sand a table and my deck as i was too cheap to rent big sander. This thing is excellent. The paper moves a bit but you can adjust it rapidly. Creates tons of dust but that is because it is eating up whatever you are sanding.
customer_reviews.author: DF

customer_reviews.title: Great power and easy to handle...
customer_reviews.text: This sander works well and is easy to handle. It comes with a belt but you'll want to have belts of differing grits to best accomplish good results. The belts are easy to change, and stay aligned in the sander. The dust bag works well and is easy to empty. I am satisfied with this sander and I would recommend it to others...
customer_reviews.author: ChuckleHead

customer_reviews.title: well built tool
customer_reviews.text: I dont have a lot of run time on this yet, but i was very happy with the overall construction when i pulled it out of the box, and the cord on it is quite nice, something lacking on a lot of cheaper tools these days. This sander works well, is easy to change belts on and is built like a tank from what i can tell.
customer_reviews.author: j

customer_reviews.title: Heavy but great. But heavy means not cheap plastic.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve only used it once for about an hour but it is hands down better than an old Craftsman I inherited from my dad. It wouldn’t track no matter what it did. This one is fairly heavy but it works. What more can you say.
customer_reviews.author: Dave4047

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sander
customer_reviews.text: Compared to my Craftsman sander this one beats it hands down. Used the sander to rebuild my large deck and it worked better than I thought it would. I had to reuse some of the boards that were painted and the railing. This sander cut through the old pain with ease. Be careful not to let it sit in one spot too long because it will leave a dip in the wood. Not the fault of the sander but the operator.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, useful tool
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this as part of a project to refurbish some decking. To my surprise, even at 9 amps and only 3" wide it is a little underpowered. Other than that, no complaints. Dust collection system works pretty well. Noise is manageable with hearing protection. It tracks very well, and, so far, has held up to heavy use.
customer_reviews.author: Steve D

customer_reviews.title: Get
customer_reviews.text: After burning out a low end Makita and cheap harbor freight belt sander, I went for the hitachi. Comparatively it is a well made beautiful product. Very high quality construction, tracks nicely, very good dust capture, wide speed variation. Just another great Hitachi tool.
customer_reviews.author: J&K

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the price
customer_reviews.text: The function and power of the sander this plenty adequate. The lateral travel of the belt needs a bit more attention than I’d like, but the adjustment knob is conveniently located and not difficult to tune during use. Hooks up to my shopvac nice and snugly with braided nylon tubing used as a coupler.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew R. Garvoille

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived fast but most definitely opened. Doesnt look used but wtf? I didnt order an open box version.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Maybe mine came defective?
customer_reviews.text: Sander works but dust collector bag is basically useless. Even with a shop vac hooked up the dust shoots EVERYWHERE. Not sure if it's a defective model or what...
customer_reviews.author: Heather K

customer_reviews.title: Well built sander.
customer_reviews.text: This is a fairly heavy and well built sander, weighing in at around 9 pounds. The bag collects most of the dust, but not all. The belt tracks true, no wandering. Once the belt is installed, set the tracking and it stays set. I've noticed some uneven contact with the surface, but I'm using it overhead, sanding some house siding, so the issue may be the way I'm holding the machine over my head. I haven't tried the sander on a flat level surface. The best part of this machine is the belt installation lever. Pull the lever back, install the belt, move the lever forward. Very simple, quick, and easy. Very nice!
customer_reviews.author: SeeFortyFive

customer_reviews.title: Good tools are a beautiful thing.
customer_reviews.text: It is as advertised. Made short work of sanding my small deck off my back door. Well made. Nice design. Dinged it one star because the belt wanders and is a bit difficult for me to adjust on the fly. I am a complete novice with power sanders, however.
customer_reviews.author: Braunsky

customer_reviews.title: Get this because it works
customer_reviews.text: This thing was surprisingly a great workhorse. I sanded about 300 sq ft of old wood floors and it breezed right through it. The belt tracking and dust collection worked amazing. Overall, I am very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: H. tran

customer_reviews.title: I haven't been disappointed. I have used it to refinish my maple ...
customer_reviews.text: I had never heard of Hitachi power tools before buying this one. I haven't been disappointed. I have used it to refinish my maple floors and for finishing off a rough pine mantle.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: I use this exclusively to grind and/or grain metal. Hasn't melted or caught fire yet like all the other brands I've owned.
customer_reviews.author: MM1

customer_reviews.title: Buy it!
customer_reviews.text: What's not to like? Came in very good condition, plenty of power and runs like a champ. Have completed several projects with it and no problems. Great addition to our carpentry business.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Finn

customer_reviews.title: This works great and I certainly got my moneys worth out of ...
customer_reviews.text: This works great and I certainly got my moneys worth out of it. I am slightly under impressed with the dust collection, but aside from that, I am truly happy with this purchase. I had no issues with the belt tracking after some minor adjustments.
customer_reviews.author: AaronGH

customer_reviews.title: This is the one to buy
customer_reviews.text: I decided on this model because the cheaper price. I'm so glad I didn't spend more, because this thing is awesome (BA). It would be a waste of money to spend more based on several uses.
customer_reviews.author: VistaGlenn

customer_reviews.title: Relatively light weight, easy to handle and control
customer_reviews.text: This is the first and only belt sander I have ever used so I cannot compare it to any other. It is easy to handle and control. It is relatively light weight. Belt changes are hassle free as are the belt adjustments. I used it on 12x2x10 long Douglas fir planks and had no problems. It was slightly irritating to constantly monitor the belt as it moved out of position and had to be readjusted but this may happen with all belt sanders. I would not use this size belt sander for large projects such as refinishing a floor.
customer_reviews.author: flashbackblue

customer_reviews.title: High qualtity belt sander at a good price
customer_reviews.text: Used for grinding damaged and patched cement board in preparation for tile. Belt tracked well and the adjustable speed feature was useful. The bag didn't catch all the fine cement dust, but connecting a HEPA vacuum took care of that. Operated it on cement indoors and kept the room dust free.
customer_reviews.author: SBK

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine however dust bag is a waste do yourself a ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine however dust bag is a waste do yourself a favor and attach your vacuum hose to sander prior to use or sand outside!
customer_reviews.author: Jack Saeger

customer_reviews.title: Packaging was terrible. It wasn't in original box
customer_reviews.text: Sander itself seems ok. Packaging was terrible. It wasn't in original box. It came in a box that was too big and let the sander bounce around, one side torn.
customer_reviews.author: paula howard

customer_reviews.title: Very powerful, just a bit on the heavy side ...
customer_reviews.text: Very powerful, just a bit on the heavy side if working at or above shoulder leval. Time for more shoulder exercises.

customer_reviews.title: As described

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable to use, plenty of power.
customer_reviews.text: Love it, great sander. Easy to replace the belts, controls and handles are comfortable. I've used it for some heavy sanding for several hours without fatigue. Plenty of power and the variable speed makes it easy to adjust how fast to take off the material.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect delivery & performance.

customer_reviews.title: A workhorse!

customer_reviews.title: Powerful

customer_reviews.title: ... side-ti-side to adapt to the rollers is a real nice feature. Strong motor with variable speed
customer_reviews.text: Very well made - the extra feature of allowing the sanding belt to slide from side-ti-side to adapt to the rollers is a real nice feature. Strong motor with variable speed. Works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. G

customer_reviews.title: Love it. Also
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Also, the bag works great for capturing dust, way better than anything I've used in the past ! Great tool, highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Met all my expectations!
customer_reviews.text: For someone looking for a well priced belt sander, of industrial tool quality, then I would suggest this sander fills that need. The fact that it has a variable speed control is a bonus. I haven't used it a lot yet, but for the limited amount of work I have done with it, no disappointments! The purchase process and delivery was fast and hassle free.
customer_reviews.author: Aussiebob

customer_reviews.title: Top-of-the-line Belt Sander
customer_reviews.text: This sander is a workhorse! It performs so well that I can't see myself look for another belt sander (of this size) any time soon. High quality, superb design, solid performance. Cord placement is genius. The ability to sand flush with a right-side wall is invaluable. While it should be obvious, it may not be to everyone, so I will state it regardless -- Please take the time to clean the dust bag after each use. Cleaning the bag will extend the life of your sander (reducing back-flow of dust) and extend the life of the wire which holds the bag in place.
customer_reviews.author: Rainer Åhlfors

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great sander for the price and does what I need to do!
customer_reviews.author: Badger Mountain

customer_reviews.title: Buy this sander you will be glad you did!
customer_reviews.text: Now this is a belt sander. I make furniture out of old wine barrels and there is a lot of sanding involved. This is my third belt sander purchase this year, the first two were less than $100 sanders and a waste of money. I finally decided to invest some money and glad I did. This sander cut my sanding time in half, does not easyt the belts like the cheaper sanders and actually puts the sawdust in the bag. Wow what a change. I used to get covered in sawdust and never had to empty the bags. Not anymore. This is a great sander - buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Janine Smith/Steve Citron

customer_reviews.title: perfect for my needs

This was an excellent machine and I periodically put it through its paces but wouldn't you know a year and a week after purchasing it, it started failing me. I think the brushes might be gone but the warrantee wouldn't cover it so I'm having to have some local repair facility ship it out to have it repaired. Disappointed.

customer_reviews.title: Fine product

I wish the speed control was more accessible while running. Two personal issues: I have RA in both hands and it is a little to heavy in some positions, and the handle would be easier for me if it were a little higher. These probably will not be a problem for most others and otherwise I would have given it 5 stars.

customer_reviews.title: Dust collection is excellent as is belt alignment
customer_reviews.text: Have used this sander quite a bit and it seems to work fairly well. Dust collection is excellent as is belt alignment. I wish the weight balance were better however. Good value for the money.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent as long as it lasts!!!
customer_reviews.text: I went through a lot of reviews and went with this. I have no idea where other users have a problem with it "digging in on the motor side". I don't think they've ever used a belt sander before. Never have I seen nearly no dust and this felt light and super easy to use. The window to watch the belt I have no use for. The only thing I wish they did differently was put the belt control knob where I could see it. Not much for reaching under where I can't see when it's running. Time will be the biggest factor on how long it lasts. The prior Craftsman went forever til I let my GF use it.

product_meta.description:
Style:Hitachi SB8V2Hitachi SB8V2 9-Amp Variable Speed Belt Sander, 3-Inch by 21-Inch.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The Hitachi SB8V2 9-Amp Variable Speed Belt Sander features a powerful 9.0-Amp (1,020-Watt) motor for the toughest material removal applications with a no-load speed of 820 to 1,475-feet per minute. Ideal for wood, steel and paint removal, the SB8V2's service life is 2-times longer than standard belt sanders thanks to a wear-resistant V-belt. Corner sanding is improved because the dust bag is now located on the left side of the tool and the main body is flush with the belt pulley on the right. Other upgraded features include a variable speed dial, clear front cover and soft elastomer covered grip on both the main and sub handles. A dust collection bag reduces airborne particles and keeps the work area clean. The Hitachi SB8V2 9-Amp Variable Speed Belt Sander is warranted to the original purchaser to be free from defect in materials and workmanship for a period of 5-years from the original purchase date. Hitachi Power Tools (Hitachi Koki USA, Ltd.) provides professional-grade power tools for a variety of applications, including woodwork, metalwork, concrete, drilling, cutting and fastening. Since its inception, Hitachi has pioneered innovative technologies that have improved the quality of craftsmanship worldwide. Hitachi is a leader in power tool research and development and has achieved many firsts in the power tool industry. Today, Hitachi continues the tradition of innovation and engineering with new features in addition to classic quality.
